originalText.text: Twenty years ago, My Home was just a small store front located on Amsterdam and West 90th street. Since they were in the neighborhood, I thought, "Why not"? Never did I realize that I would continue my relationship with My Home 20 years later to have my kitchen renovated again. What I am particularly impressed by (of many things) is the level of craftmenship and attention to detail. If something is not to your liking, it is fixed. For example, I was not happy with how the base cabinets were installed. They were in fact installed properly but I wanted something different. My project manager, Robbie Goldberg (who is simply amazing) looked at me puzzled and said, "Are you sure?" I was sure. It was a reasonably big job to redo the base cabinets in the way I wanted but at no point did I feel like this would be a problem. Robbie said with his usual upbeat and positive attitude, "When you're happy, we're happy." He told his workers to make the changes and they did. I couldn't be more thrilled with my updated, spiffy new kitchen with a beautiful new floor. beautiful cabinets and a glorious paint job. I ultimately kept my vintage red countertops which was not a problem to keep and reinstall. Since you get what you pay for, My Home is not for bargain hunters. They are flexible when determining labor and materials, but you get what you pay for and for me--the second time around, I am just as happy as I was with the results now as when My Home first did work for me. Just because I know how helpful reviews are, the photos below show the excellent grout work, my steam pipe matches the walls, the beautiful bamboo floor and installation of the molding, the flawless paint job and the perfect installation of the microwave. I highly recommend My Home. They are an amazing company that operates in a way few do--with humanity, kindness and a willingness to find a solution when a problem arises. They deal with the whole customer because they know a renovation is a highly personal and stressful endeavor. Thank you My Home. Thank you Robbie and everyone on the team who helped make my renovated kitchen look amazing.

originalText.text:
I worked with MyHome to renovate my 2BR on the UWS earlier this year. Running through a short list of candidates, I felt most comfortable with Andrew and his team.

They handled most everything and while they were not the cheapest contractors (nor the highest bidder), I love the work and the way they navigated the process for me.

Andrew walked me through all of my options and I think we ended up doing the right amount of work. He was very honest about how he would renovate if it was his and his wife's space and it helped me and mine make decisions.

Robbie and the crew made the actual renovation a breeze. The attention to detail from top-to-bottom was refreshing - even at times unexpected. My favorite detail are the doors and trim, we didnt go white and I love it - there is a picture here to see.

Really cant say enough about it. Love the team there!

originalText.text: We had a sizeable kitchen and pantry renovation. I had a few bumps and bruises in the initial phases but the owner was very responsive, quick to remediate, and assigned me Robbie Goldberg who became my key point of contact. He made everything super smooth and easy from the day I first met with him til the end of construction. The service and quality of work managed by Robbie and his crew was what warranted this 5 star rating. Robbie was also super knowledgeable, would be very open on what works and what doesn’t, and a great problem solver when unexpected things pop up.

originalText.text: I had the most fantastic experience doing a major renovation of a 2000 square foot apartment in Manhattan. Each person involved with the project ( michael p, Justin S, Rafael P) we’re all professional, always helpful, always on time and each one really knew their area of expertise. I am now currently in my newly renovated home and walk around in utter amazement as to what was done. There are no mistakes. Everything went according to plan and even their pricing was on target. I had no idea that remodeling an apartment could be such a wonderful experience. I miss these guys already ! Truly !

originalText.text: Myhome did our 2 bathrooms in our NY apartment and that was very professionaly done.  So after a year or so we had Myhome redo the kitchen with fabulous results.  And what is so great about them they stand by the warranty the gave.  They do come out if you have an issue and take care of it free of charge.
